title: Pune Reformed Baptist Church (1689) — Reading-first church website (frontend)

requirements.summary: Establish a mobile-first, minimalist, reading-optimized design system (palette + typography + layout) with restrained motion.
acceptanceCriteria: Site-wide typography is optimized for reading (comfortable line-height/measure) and consistent across pages.
Color palette matches the specified tones (deep blue/charcoal/warm gray/off-white) and is applied consistently via a shared design system.
No autoplay video, parallax, or attention-grabbing animations are present.
All pages are responsive and readable on mobile widths (no horizontal scrolling; navigation usable on small screens).

file_operations.description: Create/define global base styles and CSS variables for the reverent palette (deep blue, charcoal, warm gray, off-white), reading-first typography (measure, line-height), and restrained defaults (no animation-heavy globals).

Adjust Tailwind theme tokens (via CSS variables already referenced) and typography plugin defaults to support long-form reading and the specified palette; keep motion utilities available but do not introduce flashy animations.
Create a shared layout component that enforces distraction-free content width, consistent headings, and mobile-first spacing across all pages.
Create a small wrapper component for long-form reading sections using Tailwind typography classes and consistent vertical rhythm.

requirements.summary: Implement required routes/pages and a responsive top-level navigation that works on desktop and mobile with active-route indication.
acceptanceCriteria: Top-level navigation provides access to all required pages on desktop and mobile.
Each route renders the correct page content and page title/heading.
Navigation highlights the active route (or otherwise clearly indicates current page).

file_operations.description: Create the app router and route table for: Home, About Us, Our Confession, What We Believe, Worship With Us, Sermons, Discipleship, Resources, Contact & Visit Us; ensure document titles/headings align with routes.

Create a responsive header with desktop navigation and mobile menu, including active-route indication. Use shadcn-ui navigation primitives (e.g., NavigationMenu/Sheet/Button) to support accessible navigation; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a small navigation link wrapper that styles active vs inactive states consistently (desktop + mobile).
Create the Home page route component and wire into the router.
Create the About Us page route component and wire into the router.
Create the Our Confession (1689 LBCF) page route component and wire into the router.
Create the What We Believe page route component and wire into the router.
Create the Worship With Us page route component and wire into the router.
Create the Sermons archive page route component and wire into the router.
Create a sermon detail page route component (e.g., by id) and wire into the router to support uncluttered metadata reading.
Create the Discipleship page route component and wire into the router.
Create the Resources page route component and wire into the router.
Create the Contact & Visit Us page route component and wire into the router.

requirements.summary: Ensure all user-facing copy is English, Christ-centered, Scripture-saturated, reverent/confessional in tone, and uses only ESV/NKJV quotations with attribution.
acceptanceCriteria: All page copy follows the specified tone (reverent, doctrinally precise, pastoral) and avoids seeker-marketing phrasing.
No political, cultural, or social commentary is included in the content.
Any Scripture quotations included are explicitly labeled/attributed as ESV or NKJV and no other translation is quoted.

file_operations.description: Centralize Scripture quotations used across pages and ensure each quotation is explicitly attributed (ESV or NKJV only).
Centralize key site copy blocks (welcome text, visit instructions, page intros) to keep tone consistent and avoid political/cultural/social commentary.
Update Home page copy to match the specified confessional, pastoral tone and ensure any Scripture quotation is labeled ESV or NKJV.
Update About page copy to match tone constraints and avoid marketing language and commentary.
Update Confession page introduction copy to clearly express Scripture’s supreme authority and keep a reverent tone.
Update Beliefs page copy to be doctrinally precise and add section-by-section ESV/NKJV-labeled quotations.
Update Worship page copy to avoid entertainment/performance framing and keep visitor guidance warm-but-reverent.
Update Discipleship page copy to be pastoral/invitational and ensure Scripture quotations are labeled ESV or NKJV.
Update Resources annotations to maintain the reverent tone and avoid any political/cultural/social commentary.
Update Contact page copy (instructions and form helper text) to remain reverent, clear, and free of marketing language.

requirements.summary: Build the Home page with a Christ-centered welcome, an attributed ESV/NKJV verse, Lord’s Day service info, and a prominent CTA labeled exactly “Join Us This Lord’s Day”.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page displays a welcome section, a Scripture quotation labeled ESV or NKJV, and service information.
CTA text matches exactly “Join Us This Lord’s Day” and is visually prominent above the fold on mobile and desktop.
CTA navigates to an appropriate page section (e.g., Worship With Us or Contact & Visit Us) that provides next-step visit details.

file_operations.description: Implement Home content sections: Christ-centered welcome, a single ESV/NKJV-attributed Scripture quotation, clear Lord’s Day times and location placeholder, and a prominent CTA button/link with text exactly “Join Us This Lord’s Day” linking to Worship or Contact/Visit.
Create a consistent primary CTA component for the site. Use shadcn-ui Button to provide accessible styling; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add an anchorable ‘visit next steps’ section so the Home CTA can land on concrete visit details (service times, location placeholder).

requirements.summary: Create the About Us page content: identity (1689-aligned), brief history (placeholder dates ok), and leadership (reverent placeholder names/titles).
acceptanceCriteria: About Us page includes distinct sections for identity, history, and leadership.
Identity explicitly references alignment with the 1689 London Baptist Confession of Faith.
Leadership section uses reverent, appropriate titles (e.g., Elders) and does not introduce celebrity-style language.

file_operations.description: Add distinct Identity, History, and Leadership sections; explicitly reference alignment with the 1689 London Baptist Confession of Faith; use respectful placeholder elder names/titles.
Create a reusable Section component to keep headings/spacing consistent and suitable for reading-first layout.

requirements.summary: Create the Our Confession page with an introduction (Scripture supreme; confession subordinate) and a structured long-form reading layout for the 1689 LBCF.
acceptanceCriteria: Page contains an introduction affirming Scripture’s supreme authority and the confession’s subordinate role.
Confession content is presented in a long-form-friendly layout (clear headings/sections).
No content suggests the confession replaces or supersedes Scripture.

file_operations.description: Implement an introductory section on Scripture’s supreme authority and the confession as a subordinate standard; render the confession in a structured, long-form-friendly layout with clear headings and sections.
Add a structured representation of the 1689 confession content (chapters/sections) suitable for long-form display and easy future replacement with the full text.
Create a long-form document renderer component (headings, section spacing, optional table-of-contents links) optimized for reading.

requirements.summary: Create the What We Believe page with distinct doctrinal sections and ESV/NKJV-attributed Scripture quotations throughout.
acceptanceCriteria: Page includes distinct sections for Gospel, Doctrines of Grace, Covenant Theology (1689), Worship (Regulative Principle), Baptism, and the Lord’s Supper.
At least one Scripture quotation per major section is included and labeled ESV or NKJV.
Language is confessional and precise; avoids marketing jargon and casual slang.

file_operations.description: Implement required sections (Gospel; Doctrines of Grace; Covenant Theology per 1689; Regulative Principle; Believer’s Baptism; Lord’s Supper) and embed at least one labeled ESV/NKJV quotation per section.
Create a Scripture quote component that enforces visible translation attribution (ESV/NKJV) and consistent styling within long-form reading pages.

requirements.summary: Create the Worship With Us page describing Lord’s Day gathering, a simple reverent liturgy outline, and a practical what-to-expect section without entertainment framing.
acceptanceCriteria: Page includes sections for Lord’s Day gathering, liturgy outline, and what-to-expect.
Content explicitly avoids entertainment/performance framing of worship.
Visitor guidance is practical, warm, and reverent (no casual slang).

file_operations.description: Add sections for Lord’s Day gathering, a simple liturgy outline (call to worship, prayer, Scripture reading, psalm/hymn singing, preaching, sacraments as applicable), and a what-to-expect section (attire, family/children, service length placeholders) with reverent tone.
Create a clean, minimal list component for the liturgy outline to keep the page readable and uncluttered.

requirements.summary: Implement a Sermons archive listing sermons loaded from the backend, plus a detail view (page) for full metadata without clutter.
acceptanceCriteria: Sermons archive displays a list of sermons with title, passage, preacher, and date.
Users can open a sermon to view full metadata (detail page or expandable view).
Sermons data is loaded from the backend canister (not hardcoded only in the UI).

file_operations.description: Create React Query hooks that load sermons from the backend actor (list and get-by-id) via the existing actor wiring.
Render a sermons archive list showing title, Scripture reference, preacher, date, and optional audio link; ensure data is fetched via React Query hooks (not hardcoded only).
Render a sermon detail view with full metadata in a reading-friendly layout; include an optional audio link when present.
Create a list-row/card component for sermon summaries. Use shadcn-ui Card/Button as appropriate for accessible interaction; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Create the Discipleship page content covering membership, catechism, and family worship with ESV/NKJV quotations and pastoral tone.
acceptanceCriteria: Page includes sections for membership, catechism, and family worship.
Mentions elder-led congregationalism in a clear, non-polemical manner.
All Scripture quotations are labeled ESV or NKJV.

file_operations.description: Implement distinct sections for meaningful membership (including elder-led congregationalism), catechism use, and family worship encouragement; add labeled ESV/NKJV quotations where used.

requirements.summary: Create a Resources page with curated confessions, catechisms, and recommended reading, each with reverent annotations and safe outbound links.
acceptanceCriteria: Resources are grouped into the three required categories.
Each resource includes a title and a brief description in the requested tone.
Outbound links (if used) are clearly marked and open safely (no inline tracking/political content).

file_operations.description: Implement three sections (Confessions, Catechisms, Recommended Reading) with brief reverent annotations and safe outbound links (placeholder URLs allowed).
Create a simple list component for resources that supports titles, short descriptions, and safe external links (e.g., using rel protections).

requirements.summary: Create Contact & Visit Us page with location/service timings and a contact form (name/email/message) that submits to the backend with validation and clear success/error states.
acceptanceCriteria: Contact page includes location info and service timings.
Contact form validates required fields and shows submission feedback (loading/success/error).
Submitted messages are stored via the backend canister and can be retrieved via a backend query (for verification/testing).

file_operations.description: Create a React Query mutation hook that submits contact form data to the backend actor and exposes loading/success/error states.
Implement location section (Pune placeholder address), service timings, and a validated contact form (name, email, message) with clear loading/success/error UI and no external email/SMS providers.

Create a reusable contact form component with required-field validation and clear submission feedback. Use shadcn-ui Form/Input/Textarea/Button components if available to ensure accessible inputs; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a small component for consistent success/error messaging (including a non-intrusive success confirmation state). Use shadcn-ui Alert components if available; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add and integrate a small set of reverent static images (generated assets) into headers/sections, prioritizing readability and restrained presentation.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are present under frontend/public/assets/generated and are used in at least the Home and Worship With Us pages.
Images are displayed with restrained sizing/cropping and do not degrade readability on mobile.
No performance-stage/worship-concert visual motifs are used (e.g., spotlights, fog, stage theatrics).

file_operations.description: Add generated static image asset for Home hero usage: frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bible-pulpit.dim_1920x900.png.
Add generated static image asset for subdued congregational header usage: frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-congregation-reverent.dim_1920x900.png.
Add generated static image asset for small section use: frontend/public/assets/generated/prayer-hands.dim_1200x1200.png.
Add generated static image asset for Worship/Supper section header usage: frontend/public/assets/generated/lords-table-elements.dim_1920x900.png.
Create a restrained page header image component that supports readable overlays/spacing without dominating the page (mobile-first).
Integrate frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bible-pulpit.dim_1920x900.png into the Home header/hero area with restrained sizing so it does not distract from reading.

Integrate frontend/public/assets/generated/lords-table-elements.dim_1920x900.png and/or frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-congregation-reverent.dim_1920x900.png into Worship With Us sections with restrained presentation for mobile readability.
